heading: 1.1 Introdution
text: Network analysis widely applied life sciences, microbiology, ecology, agronomy quantify interactions among genes, proteins, metabolites, microorganisms, environmental factors. interactions collectively shape functioning biological ecological systems. Despite broad adoption, existing tools often face limitations flexibility, customization, reproducibility, generation publication-ready figures.address challenges, ggNetView developed R package integrates ggplot2, ggraph, tidygraph within Grammar Graphics framework, enabling fully reproducible highly customizable network visualizations. package provides deterministic layout algorithms, comprehensive topological analyses, modular coloring schemes, hierarchical annotations, consistent theming, ensuring standardized interpretable graphical output.Although initially designed applications soil science microbial ecology, ggNetView broadly applicable network analyses molecular biology, including WGCNA protein–protein interaction (PPI) networks. lowering technical barriers network construction visualization, ggNetView enables researchers across disciplines efficiently produce reproducible, publication-quality network figures.

graph_obj <- build_graph_from_mat(
  mat = otu_rare_relative,
  transfrom.method = "none", #  based your input data
  r.threshold = 0.7,
  p.threshold = 0.05,
  method = "WGCNA",

heading: 2.2 Build graph from data frame
code:
# Access built-in example datasets in ggNetView
data("ppi_example")
df = ppi_example$ppi
head(df)##   from  to    weight
## 1   A1 D40  9.306533
## 2   A2 D39 11.783920
## 3   A3 D38 23.005025
## 4   A4 D37  7.412060
## 5   A5 D36 18.778894
## 6   A6 D35 16.592965
node_annotation = ppi_example$annotation
head(node_annotation)##   node group
## 1   A1     A
## 2   A2     A
## 3   A3     A
## 4   A4     A
## 5   A5     A
## 6   A6     A
graph_obj_from_df <- build_graph_from_df(
  df = df,
  node_annotation = node_annotation,
  directed = F,
  module.method = "Fast_greedy",
  top_modules = 15,
  seed = 1115
)
